Name: Mummy cartonnage
Description: Polychrome painted side of a mummy case, with beaded band of rosettes in an upper register, above a line of deities facing right and standing on a boat. The register of deities has blocked backgrounds of red and blue. The spaces for hieroglyphs have been left blank, but the scene can be identified from parallels as a depiction of the boat of the sun-god with his retinue. The style of the figures is characteristic of the late Ptolemaic to Roman Period.
